author: n3tsurge
description: This capability focuses on identifying data that has been transferred based on its content. It is essential for understanding the nature of data movement within a network, especially in cases of potential data exfiltration or unauthorized access. By analyzing the content of transferred data, security teams can detect anomalies and respond to potential threats effectively.

requirements.description: Access to relevant logging systems and data sources required for analysis.
Knowledge of indicators, patterns, and techniques relevant to this identification capability.
Tools and systems capable of collecting, processing, and analyzing relevant data.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: Find Data Transferred by Content Pattern

references.name: NIST SP 800-34 Rev. 1: Contingency Planning Guide for Federal Information Systems
SANS: Data Backup and Recovery Best Practices
CISA Data Backup Options and Strategies
